content: Hi release-team, I've opened an issue at https://github.com/rust-lang/release-team/issues/9 about the current support for Android. Any chance to get some feedback on it? Thanks

I don't think we're going to be able to come to good conclusions there yet, but I'm hopeful that as we move forward on target tier policy and so forth, we can better judge the support tier for android API levels along a similar framework to target triple support; they seem like really similar concepts to me.

Right, so if I'm interpreting https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/2803/files#diff-42e166b941abc9c20783eda62a247871e9d409dec38fb3fc788b7d1c9db2edb0R290 correctly, for the -android target, that would mean creating a new pull request to capture how this (new) target satisfies all the criteria of tier2? I think the proposal I linked would also tick the "document its baseline expectations for [..] operating systems, libraries, runtime environments[..]" part of that RFC. Have the "target maintainers" been defined for -android yet?
No, that rfc hasn't even been accepted quite yet :) I'd need to re read it to be sure of the right steps per it, but there's not really a policy other than that laid out in the rfc either.
Right, I understand. And on the target maintainers question, is there any point of contact I could reach to? Thanks
Hm, you mean to volunteer as a target maintainer? I don't think we've defined how to do so yet.
